19990921.title: 921 Earthquake
19990921.str: Also known as the 921 Earthquake, it occurred at 1:47:15.9 AM on September 21, 1999. The epicenter was at a depth of 8 kilometers with a Richter magnitude of 7.3. It was a reverse fault earthquake in the central mountainous area of Taiwan, lasting approximately 102 seconds. The shaking was felt throughout the island. The epicenter was located in Jiji Township, Nantou County.

20100304.title: Jiaxian Earthquake
20100304.str: The Jiaxian Earthquake occurred at 8:18 AM local time on March 4, 2010. The epicenter was at a depth of 22.6 kilometers with a Richter magnitude of 6.4. It occurred at the border between Taoyuan Township and Maolin Township in Kaohsiung County, specifically 17.1 kilometers southeast of the Jiaxian Seismic Station in Kaohsiung.

20160206.title: Meinong Earthquake
20160206.str: A strong earthquake in Meinong, Kaohsiung, caused a nearly 200-meter-long fissure with a maximum height difference of about 3 meters on the 8th hole of Section B of the Nanbao Golf Course in Dainei District, Tainan City.

20180206.title: Hualien Earthquake
20180206.str: At 11:50 PM on February 6, 2018, with a depth of 6.3 kilometers and a Richter magnitude of 6.2, an earthquake struck near the coast of Hualien County, Taiwan. Prior to and after this earthquake, there were several earthquakes with Richter magnitudes above 5.

20220918.title: Chihshang Earthquake
20220918.str: On the evening of September 17, 2022, at 9:41:19 PM, a magnitude 6.4 earthquake struck Guanshan Township, Taitung County. The shaking was felt across Taiwan. With a depth of only 7.3 kilometers, it was an extremely shallow earthquake.
